On the other side of the room is a large, free-standing loom, which resembles a grand piano.  The loom is wooden; a tapestry is half-completed.  Mary Patrick is seated at the loom, which is a complicated mechanism.  Christy stands beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The minute I saw you. I said to myself, she's a weaver.  Have you ever used a loom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not in years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it all comes back, in just a jiffy.  I'm working on a wall-hanging, of the convent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To sell, of course.  I hate to say it, but we're in terrible trouble here at St. Katherine's.  We need a new roof, the furnace is going, and there's no money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But don't you get money?  From the Vatican? Page 44.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Clarence.  Goose.  We're completely self-supporting.  Like all convents. Like yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, right.  At my old place, we used to... wash cars.  Groom dogs.  So... nice loom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't it lovely?  Now I'll demonstrate, and then you can hop right in. (as she deftly works the loom) You just draw your beater in, keep it pressed against the pick, and open the shed.  Then pass your shuttle, beat, and open the next shed.  Shuttle. beat, beat, shuttle, beat, shed.  Keep tension on the warp.  Is that clear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just about.  Show me again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You betcha. CRAFTS ROOM - AN HOUR LATER ANGLE on the wall hanging, which has progressed considerably. ANGLE on Christy, leaning against the wall, thumbing through a magazine. ANGLE on Mary Patrick, hard at work at the loom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shuttle, beat, shed.  And watch your heddles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love my heddles.  Show me again. Mother Superior appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Clarence -- how is your weaving progressing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, she's doing just fine, Reverend Mother - Page 45.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really catching on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.  Mary Patrick, I need you in the office.  Mary Clarence, carry on. Mother Superior gestures to the loom.  Christy sits at the loom, and waves as Mother Superior and Mary Patrick exit. Christy stares at the loom; a look of horror crosses her face.  She has not been paying attention to Mary Patrick's instructions.  She cracks her knuckles, as if she were about to play the piano.  She grabs two parts of the loom, at random.  She moves these parts. ANGLE on the loom.  As a result of Christy's movements, the loom collapses, piece by piece.  The tapestry unravels, the many skeins of wool snap, and the mechanical apparatus disintegrates, until finally the entire loom shudders and falls to the floor, as Christy watches, aghast. INT. CORRIDOR Mother Superior is striding down the hall; she is livid. Christy trails behind her, trying to keep up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, I'm not a weaver!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Months of work, and the loom, absolutely ruined!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, this isn't my kind of thing!  I wasn't cut out to make little tapestries, or knit little sweaters! I don't do that! I'm a star! Mother Superior stops dead in her tracks; she turns and stares at Christy.  Then she smiles, in a rather frightening manner. MONTAGE - CHRISTY A)on her hands and knees. scrubbing the stone floor of a convent hallway. B)crawling along between the pews in the chapel, oiling every inch of wood with a bottle of polish and a rag. C)crawling along the convent roof, cleaning out gutters with a trowel.  She discovers a dead rat in one of the gutters. Page 46 D)sewing; she is repairing a hole in a habit.  The CAMERA PULLS BACK.  Christy is sitting in a small stone room, surrounded by piles of torn habits, linen and other mending. INT. MOTHER SUPERIOR'S OFFICE Christy is on the phone in the darkened office.  She keeps checking the door, to make sure no one is listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me talk to Detective Eddie Mulcahy. It's an emergency.  Real bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mulcahy. Christy cups her hand around the phone and speaks quietly and frantically.  INTERCUT between Christy and Eddie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie, you've got to get me out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not again.  You can't keep calling. Somebody's going to catch on to where you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I'm going insane!  All these people do is pray and work, work and pray!  I don't get it -- when's the weekend? They have gruel, Eddie, that's what they call food!  Gruel -- it's like Alpo for nuns! I sleep in a cell, on a board, and I pray five times a days  Do you know what I pray for, Eddie, do you have any idea? Check your crotch, Eddie --anything fall off yet?  Get me outta her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calm down.  Look, I didn't want to tell you this, but we've had some problems with our protection program lately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keeping our witnesses alive.  We hide them, but there's a leak in the department, and they end up dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You son-of-a-bitch! Page 47 EDDIE I just need a few more weeks,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's a nightmare!  Mother Superior is out to get me!  She hates my guts! She keeps thinking up new kinds of torture! In the distance, Christy hears the CHOIR practicing; they sound even worse than usual.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you hear that?  That choir?  Eddie, in here, that's what they call music!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't call again.  It's not safe.  I'll be in touch. As the line goes dead, Mother Superior enters.  Christy takes her dust rag and pretends to polish the receiver. She sings as she works.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Still singing, Christy breezes out of the room.  Mother Superior looks mystified. INT. CHRISTY'S CELL - MIDNIGHT Christy is lying flat out on her bed, in her habit, utterly exhausted by the week's hard labor.  There is a meek SCRATCHING at her door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? Sister Mary Robert enters, very shyly.  She barely looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?  What does she want now?  I did the dishes.  I oiled the pews.  I dusted the hymnals.  Two hundred hymnals.  Why can't people share?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I... I... Page 48.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I brought you something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A cigarette?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An extra heel of bread.  Please take it, you need your strength.  You've been working so hard. Mary Robert holds out a rather rugged crust of brown bread.  Christy takes it..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.  So which one are you? Sister Bruce?  Sister Doug?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Robert.  I'm... Mary Robert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.  Okay.  Bob.  Nice to know you. Mary Robert nods, and resumes looking at her hands.  She doesn't 1eave, but she's still tongue-tied. Christy is at a loss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, Bob, how long have you been in? St. K's?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three years.  Sister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three years.  A rookie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A novice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, like a learner's permit, right? When do you hit the big time?  You know, when do you take the final vows? Mary Robert bursts into tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa!  Bob!  What's going on here? What'd I say? Page 49.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to help me
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right, sure, but what's the problem? Are they keeping you a prisoner here? Do they drug you?  Did Reverend Mother like, kidnap your parents?  We can call the Enquirer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you don't understand -- I don't want to get out!  I want to get in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Mary Clarence, I'm so unworthy.  I want to take my final vows, I would do it tomorrow, but Reverend Mother won't let me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She won't?  Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She says I should wait.  She says that no one should become a nun as an escape from life.  She says that I'm not experienced enough to make the decision yet.  In a mature manner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She said that?  Reverend Mother? Mary Robert nods, solemnly.  Suddenly, from the streets outside the convent, we hear a BLAST OF hot dance MUSIC, and the SOUND of laughter and carefree conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, then there's only one thing to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reverend Mother says you need experience, right, in life.  In order to make a responsible decision.  This is going to be very painful for me.  You know how much I love this little room. This whole convent.  Wait. Christy stands, and goes to the crucifix hanging on the wall.  She speaks to the crucifix, and listens, as if Jesus is advising her. Page 50.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must I do this thing, 0 Lord?  Please help me.,. yes, I know... I must put my selfish cares aside... I must think of others... yes, she's here... (she gestures to Mary Robert) He says hi... yes, I understand... let thy will be done.  Amen.  You too. Christy turns to Mary Robert, having received a holy message.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We must do this sacred thing, Mary Robert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course!  We must do it!  It's the will of God!  What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We must... get you some experience.  We must... leave this place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure? Another BLAST OF MUSIC from the street.  Christy turns to the crucifix.  She gets confirmation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear you. EXT. STREET The outer wall of the convent.  A door swings open, and Christy sticks her head out.  She looks both ways, and steps outside.  She beckons to Mary Robert, who appears from behind her.  Mary Robert looks very wary.  Christy pulls her along. EXT. A STREET NEARBY Christy and Mary Robert walk along a street a few blocks from the convent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure this is what Reverend Mother had in mind? Page 51.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it is.  It's life.  Experience. Take a deep breath. Christy breathes deep, and then lets out a whoop.  She spins, letting her habit billow around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Clarence!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you. Mary Robert's eyes widen.  She points to herself -- "Me?" Christy nods.  Mary Robert lets out a tiny little whoop, and does a little, timid hop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a start. EXT. SOCIAL CLUB A neighborhood hang-out, the windows bright with neon beer signs.  The exterior is colorfully painted; the club all but explodes with good times.  A group of teenagers lounge on the steps, sipping beers and smoking.  Among the teenagers are the girls from Christy's Christian Youth group.  Christy and Mary Robert approach, and the group falls silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Sisters.  Are you going in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need experience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's part of St. Katherine's new community outreach program.  How old are you?  You shouldn't be smoking.  Have you ever seen a diseased lung?  Hand 'em over. Lawanda reluctantly hands over her cigarettes.  Christy turns to a TEENAGE BOY who's drinking beer. Page 52.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you, with the devil's brew passing through your lips. (holding out her hand) A mind is a terrible thing to waste. The boy hands over the beer.  Christy and Mary Robert enter the club. INT. SOCIAL CLUB Christy enters the club and grins.  She takes a drag on the cigarette.  Mary Robert grabs the beer from Christy's hand, and takes a swig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobs
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Experience!  Right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. The club is alive with activity; the bar is crowded, couples are making out at small tables, and the dance floor is packed.  The atmosphere is a combination of hazy darkness and colored lights; the club should have the feeling of a hot neighborhood party, with people of all ages and races.  The MUSIC percolates, and Christy starts to move to it.  She and Mary Robert find a table in the corner, and signal a nearby waitress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A couple of bowls of chili. (holding up the beer) And another round of these. The waitress looks at the two women strangely; the club has never hosted nuns before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to do this.  So I can become a nun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Initiation.  You understand.  Later on, we make her wear her underwear on her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? Page 53 CHRISTY (to the waitress) And she wants to be a nun. The waitress leaves, shaking her head.  Christy and Mary Robert watch the action at the club. Across the room, MIKE the bartender stares at the nuns, especially Christy; he tries to place her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are all these people?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is your neighborhood.  Your turf. You should get to know 'em. From across the room, Mike the bartender continues to study Christy's face.  He takes out a copy of Vince's fax photo and stares at it.  He covers Christy's hair in the photo with his hands, creating a wimple.  There is no question in his mind; the two are the same.  Mike has a dangerous look in his eyes as he takes a gun from the drawer and slips it into his pocket beneath his apron. There is a LIVE BAND on a small stage at one end of the club.  They start playing a hot dance number, and the club really begins to cook, as the dance floor fills.  Christy and Mary Robert, both still seated, start to move with the music. A very good-looking LOCAL DUDE comes over to the nuns table.  He is clearly amused at their presence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Sisters -- how you doin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come they let you out?  Out of that convent place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time off.  For bad behavior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oww!  A nun havin' fun!  I don't believe it!  It's good to have you ladies in this fine establishment.  So... anybody on the move?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am. Page 54.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob!  What're you doing? Mary Robert leads the Dude out onto the dance floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm getting experience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You watch yourself! Christy decides she'd better keep an eye on Mary Robert; she grabs another DUDE, and heads for the dance floor. As the music percolates, Christy and Mary Robert dance; Christy is very hot, and Mary Robert picks up on her moves. The CLUB PATRONS are delighted, and cheer as the nuns start to get down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it, Sisters!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sway and pray! As the song, and the nuns' exuberant dancing, peak, the Club Patrons cheer, shouting "Hallelujah!" and "Amen!" EXT. STREET - NIGHT Christy and Mary Robert are walking back to the convent. They are both in very good spirits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those people are wonderful!  Why don't we ever see them in church?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good point.  Especially that dude you were with.  I'd like to see him down front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Clarence!  You're so... different from the other sisters.  Sometimes, well... sometimes you sound more like a layperson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey. As the two women laugh together, they don't notice the car that begins to follow them, creeping slowly forward with its headlights out. Page 55.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't wait to tell Reverend Mother about all my experiences.  I've learned so much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you know, you don't have to tell her everything.  I mean, nothing really happened.  We just... took a walk. The car's bright lights suddenly switch on, and the nuns turn, startled.  The car hurtles toward them.  They scream, and Christy grabs Mary Robert and throws her out of the car's path; the two women land on a pile of garbage bags. Struggling to her feet, Christy sees the car go into reverse, and then pull forward again.  She sees a glint of light reflect off a gun as the car's driver (Mike the bartender) leans out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run! Christy shoves Mary Robert towards an alley.  As she does so, the gun GOES OFF with a red flash.  The shot misses the two women and SHATTERS a plate glass window of the store behind them. EXT. ALLEY Running up the alley, Christy and Mary Robert hear Mike's FOOTSTEPS chasing them, growing louder as he gains on them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Clarence! CHRISTY Keep moving! Christy grabs the ladder of a fire escape, and shoves Mary Robert up the ladder ahead of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Climb!  Now! As Christy and Mary Robert climb the fire escape, another GUNSHOT ECHOES in the alley, ricocheting off the fire escape. The nuns climb higher up the building.  Mike pursues, looking for a shot between the steps and the landings, but not finding any openings.  He takes the steps two at a time and begins to gain ground. At the fourth floor landing, Christy's heel gets stuck in the grating.  She pulls frantically at the laces. Page 56.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamn it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Clarence! Mike arrives at the landing just as Christy twists her toot out of the shoe, and surprises him with a lunge for the gun.  Mike's hand is knocked back against the metal frame of the fire escape, and the gun flies loose, RATTLING down the metal steps to the landing below.  Christy shoves Mary Robert into the open window of an apartment, and follows her in. INT. TENEMENT APARTMENT Christy and Mary Robert leap into the bedroom of an Hispanic couple, their arms wrapped around each other in bed.  At the women's entrance, the couple looks up, stunned to see two nuns in their bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my Lord!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Experience! The couple continues to look stunned as the nuns race out of the room. EXT. CONVENT - NIGHT Christy and Mary Robert run up to the side door of the convent; they catch their breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was all that?  Who was that man? Why would he shoot at us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, some people just don't like nuns.  I wish I had a ruler.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could have been killed!  But you saved me! (throwing her arms around Christy) Thank you, Mary Clarence! The door to the convent swings open.  Mother Superior is waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes -- thank you so much. Page 57 INT.CONVENT CORRIDOR - DAY Christy sits alone outside Mother Superior's office, listening to the loud TICKING of the clock on the wall. She seems small and vulnerable, like a child sent to the principal's office. The door opens and Eddie emerges from the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd she say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You blew it -- big time.  She doesn't want you back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does she know people are trying to kill me out there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's counting on it.  She's concerned for your safety, but she wants me to try and find another convent that will take you. Or a carnival.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what am I supposed to do in the meantime?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go in and talk to her.  It can't hurt. (urging her) Go. Reluctantly, Christy rises and approaches the door.  She looks at Eddie, who motions her to go in.  She finally does. INT. MOTHER SUPERIOR'S OFFICE Mother Superior is working on some papers at her desk as Christy enters.  Christy is trying to figure out a strategy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So... hi there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe we have anything to say to each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look... I know I shouldn't have, I'm incredibly sorry about Mary Robert, I wasn't thinking, I didn't know that would happen! Page 58. Mother Superior glances up from her work.  She is justifiably outraged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Robert's life was in danger! Your behavior was inexcusable!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know!  I'm sorry   I didn't mean for it to happen!  And I was the one they were shooting at!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Clarence, I have given you every opportunity.  To change.  To make a decent life for yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A decent life?  Excuse me?  As what?  A janitor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clearly, you have learned nothing. And you present an ongoing threat, both to this convent and to yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you can't kick me out!  Guys want to kill me!  You're a nun!  A big nun! Aren't you supposed to have compassion? For the wayward sheep?  I mean, I'm a major sinner!  All-time great!  Hall of Fame!  Aren't I, like, your dream come true?  Your Olympic event? Mother Superior stares at Christy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Clarence, perhaps you are correct.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may stay.  But I shall restrict your activities to but a single task.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have, I believe, some minimal background in music.  Therefore, you are to join our choir. (MORE) Page 59 MOTHER SUPERIOR (CONT'D) You will sing, and you will sleep,' that is your schedule until you depart.  As almost no one attends Mass, you will be unable to cause further damage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're my Olympic event.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not the choir, please, anything but that.  The choir -- I mean, have you heard them?  I'll do anything, scrub floors, toilets, you name it, but not that I MOTHER SUPERIOR (in triumph) The choir, Mary Clarence.  Go for the gold. INT. CHOIR REHEARSAL ROOM - THAT DAY There are twelve nuns in the room, going over sheet music. Mary Lazarus is the group's leader; Mary Patrick and Mary Robert are also in the choir.  Christy appears at the door, grimacing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this... choir practice?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure is!  Come on in, and sing a spell. Christy spots Mary Robert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Robert, I am so sorry about last night...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now stop that.  You didn't shoot at me. You were only trying to help, to give me experience.  I tried to explain that to Reverend Mother, but -- I don't know if she understood. Mary Lazarus cuts off this chitchat, thrusting a hymnal at Christy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soprano or alto?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever. Page 60. Mary Lazarus hands Christy a hymnal, and raps her baton. The choir begins to sing; Christy doesn't even bother trying.  She is horrified; the choir is the worst-sounding group in history.  They seem to be singing in several random keys, and they even have trouble with the words.  No one looks up from their hymnals.  Sister Alma, the organist with the hearing aid, is plodding along. INT. BLUE COLLAR BAR - DAY Mike the bartender is taking chairs off tables and setting them on the floor as Joey and Willy enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're looking for Mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You found him -- but we're not open yet. Willy grabs Mike's arms and bends them behind his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey -- the till's empty! Willy slams Mike's face into the wall, stunning him.  Joey lifts Mike's groggy face and offers sympathy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry -- I don't know what gets into him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you guys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're the guys from Vegas.  You had Christy last night, but you let her get away.  It's upsetting. Willy hammers Mike's face into the wall again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you didn't tell me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We didn't tell you what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That she's a nun!  That chick you're looking for -- she's a nun!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?  Christy? Page 61.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A nun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm telling you! Willy and Joey look at each other, and consider this. Then they burst out laughing.  They refuse to believe Mike's story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme a hand here. Willy and Joey pick Mike up, and hurl him over the bar. Then they exit, still laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A nun! INT. CHOIR REHEARSAL ROOM - DAY The choir continues its dreadful rendition of the hymn Let Thy Thoughts He Guided.  Christy is not singing; she is clearly in pain.  Mary Lazarus stops the song.  One of the nuns has to nudge Sister Alma to stop her playing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Clarence, are you with us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, I don't really know this one...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Clarence has a background in music. That's what Reverend Mother said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really, Mary Clarence?  Were you a choirmistress?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.  Kind of... free-lance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Free-lance?  Oh really?  You think I don't see?  You think I took vows yesterday?  I know what you're up to. You and Reverend Mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a ringer.  She brought you in to replace me.  Out with the old. Page 62.
direction.name: direction
